explains: n. 自然主义者；博物学者；（英）动物标本剥制者；买卖玩赏动物的商人
adj. 自然的（等于 naturalistic）；自然主义的；博物学的

sentences.en: Perhaps the grossest thing I've done as a naturalist is to boil animal skulls.
sentences.cn: 也许我作为一个自然学家做过的最恶心的事就是煮动物的头骨。

sentences.en: He was a printer by trade and naturalist by avocation.
sentences.cn: 他在印刷厂工作，同时是个博物学爱好者。

sentences.en: At nine, his father, a naturalist who had started a reptile park on the Queensland coast, taught him to stalk crocs at night and lug them out of the water.
sentences.cn: 九岁时，他的父亲，一位在昆士兰海岸开设爬行动物公园的博物学家，教他在夜间跟踪鳄鱼并把它们拖出水面。
